title: following regulations apply would not offend against principles of proper
heading: 1. (1) These Regulations may be cited as the Planning and Development
text_raw:
1. (1) These Regulations may be cited as the Planning and Development 

Act 2000 (Exempted Development) (No. 3) Regulations 2022. 

(2) These Regulations shall be included in the collective citation the 

Planning and Development Regulations 2001 to 2022. 

Interpretation
text_norm: 1 (1) regulation may cited planning development act 2000 (exempted development) (no 3) regulation 2022 (2) regulation shall included collective citation planning development regulation 2001 2022 interpretation

title: following regulations apply would not offend against principles of proper
heading: In these Regulations “Principal Regulations” means the Planning and
text_raw:
2. 

In these Regulations “Principal Regulations” means the Planning and 

Development Regulations 2001 (S.I. No. 600 of 2001). 

Amendment of Article 5 of the Principal Regulations
text_norm: 2 regulation principal regulation mean planning development regulation 2001 (s.i no 600 2001) amendment article 5 principal regulation

title: following regulations apply would not offend against principles of proper
heading: 3. (1) Article 5(1) of the Principal Regulations is amended by inserting the
text_raw:
3. (1) Article 5(1) of the Principal Regulations is amended by inserting the 

following definition after the definition of “amusement arcade”: 

“ 

“ancillary equipment” for the purpose of rooftop solar photo-voltaic or solar 
thermal collector panels in classes 56(d), 56(e), 60 or 61 of Part 1 of Schedule 
2 and class 18(c) of Part 3 of Schedule 2 does not include any equipment which 
must be placed or erected on a wall or a rooftop to allow a solar photo-voltaic 
or solar thermal collector installation to function;”. 

(2) Article 5(1) of the Principal Regulations is amended by inserting the 

following definition after the definition of “port operational building”: 

“ 

Notice of the making of this Statutory Instrument was published in 
“Iris Oifigiúil” of 7th October, 2022. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 [493] 3 

“primarily” for the purpose of classes 56(d), 56(e), 60 or 61 of Part 1 of 
Schedule 2 and class 18(c) of Part 3 of Schedule 2 means greater than 50%;”. 

(3) Article 5(1) of the Principal Regulations is amended by inserting the 

following definition after the definition of “small cell antenna”: 

“ 

“solar safeguarding zone” has the same meaning as in the Planning and 
Development (Solar Safeguarding Zone) Regulations 2022;”. 

Amendment of Article 9 of the Principal Regulations

title: following regulations apply would not offend against principles of proper
heading: 4. Article 9(1)(a) of the Principal Regulations is amended by inserting the
text_raw:
4. Article 9(1)(a) of the Principal Regulations is amended by inserting the 

following sub-paragraph after sub-paragraph (iii): 

“(iiia) endanger public safety by reason of hazardous glint and/or glare for the 
operation of airports, aerodromes or aircraft,”. 

Amendment of Part 1 of Schedule 2 to the Principal Regulations

title: following regulations apply would not offend against principles of proper
heading: (This note is not part of the instrument and does not purport to be a legal
text_raw:
EXPLANATORY NOTE 

(This note is not part of the instrument and does not purport to be a legal 
interpretation.) 

These Regulations amend the Planning and Development Regulations 2001, as 
amended (the Principal Regulations). 

Article 5 of these Regulations amends Part 1 (Exempted Development —
General) of Schedule 2 to the Principal Regulations by amending aspects of 
Class 2, and Class 56 and adding new Classes 60 and 61 relating to exemptions 
from the requirement to obtain planning permission for certain solar 
installations. 

Article 6 of these Regulations amends Part 3 (Exempted Development —
General) of Schedule 2 to the Principal Regulations by amending aspects of 
Class 18 relating to exemptions from the requirement to obtain planning 
permission for agricultural solar installations. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 [493] 21
